summary: This is an email chain from July 31, 2020, regarding a media inquiry from the Daily Mail about newly unsealed court documents. The inquiry asks for comment on claims that Prince Andrew and Alan Dershowitz pressured the DOJ to give Jeffrey Epstein a favorable plea deal in 2007. The emails show internal DOJ/FBI coordination on how to respond.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the 2007 plea deal inquiry and the central figure in the case. Mentioned in the media inquiry regarding pressure for a favorable deal.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Described as Epstein's alleged madam and the defendant in the civil case where documents were unsealed.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Named in the media inquiry as allegedly putting pressure on the DOJ for Epstein's 2007 plea deal.

persons.name: Alan Dershowitz
persons.context: Named in the media inquiry as allegedly putting pressure on the DOJ for Epstein's 2007 plea deal.

connections.description: Maxwell is described as Epstein's alleged madam in the civil case documents referenced in the email.
The media inquiry alleges Andrew put pressure on the DOJ to give Epstein a favorable plea deal, implying a connection.
The media inquiry alleges Dershowitz put pressure on the DOJ to give Epstein a favorable plea deal, implying he acted in a legal advocacy or advisory role for Epstein.

events.title: Epstein's plea deal
events.description: The media inquiry references claims that Prince Andrew and Alan Dershowitz pressured the DOJ to give Jeffrey Epstein a favorable plea deal in 2007.

events.title: Unsealing of civil case documents
events.description: Court documents were unsealed in a civil case brought by an Epstein victim against Ghislaine Maxwell, which contained the allegations about pressure on the 2007 plea deal.

keyFacts: A Daily Mail journalist inquired about newly unsealed court documents alleging Prince Andrew and Alan Dershowitz pressured the DOJ for a favorable plea deal for Jeffrey Epstein in 2007.
The documents were unsealed in a civil case brought by an Epstein victim against Ghislaine Maxwell.
The email chain shows internal DOJ/FBI coordination, with officials noting they do not have the specific document and considering asking the reporter for a copy.
The inquiry highlights ongoing media and public interest in the connections between powerful figures and the handling of the Epstein case in 2007.
